means: 变质( spoil的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: I apologise if your enjoyment of the movie was spoiled.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果破坏了你看电影的兴致，我道歉。

sentence.Network_en: He is spoiled, arrogant and has a tendency towards snobbery.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被宠坏了，傲慢无礼，而且经常自命不凡。

sentence.Network_en: She hates me having any fun and is quite jealous and spoiled.
sentence.Network_cn: 她见不得我开心，嫉妒心强，被惯坏了。

entry.def: If you spoil something, you prevent it from being successful or satisfactory.

example.ex: It's important not to let mistakes spoil your life...
example.tran: 重要的是不要让错误毁了你的生活。

example.ex: Peaceful summer evenings can be spoilt by mosquitoes.
example.tran: 宁静的夏夜可能会被蚊子破坏掉。

entry.def: If you spoil children, you give them everything they want or ask for. This is considered to have a bad effect on a child's character.

example.ex: Grandparents are often tempted to spoil their grandchildren whenever they come to visit.
example.tran: 祖父母每次来访都往往禁不住要娇惯孙辈。

entry.def: If you spoil yourself or spoil another person, you give yourself or them something nice as a treat or do something special for them.

example.ex: Spoil yourself with a new perfume this summer...
example.tran: 今年夏天买瓶新香水慰劳一下自己吧。

example.ex: Perhaps I could employ someone to iron his shirts, but I wanted to spoil him. He was my man.
example.tran: 也许我可以雇别人来熨他的衬衫，但我想好好宠他。他是我爱的男人。

entry.def: If food spoils or if it is spoilt, it is no longer fit to be eaten.

example.ex: We all know that fats spoil by becoming rancid...
example.tran: 我们都知道油脂变质后会发臭。

example.ex: Some organisms are responsible for spoiling food and cause food poisoning...
example.tran: 有些生物会导致食物变质并引起食物中毒。

entry.tran: (因在其上写违法的内容而)使(选票)无效
entry.def: If someone spoils their vote, they write something illegal on their voting paper, usually as a protest about the election, and their vote is not accepted.

example.ex: They had broadcast calls for voters to spoil their ballot papers...
example.tran: 他们通过广播呼吁选民们投无效选票。

example.ex: The results showed that 7.2% of the voters cast blank or spoiled ballots.
example.tran: 结果显示，7.2 %的选民投了空白或无效票。

entry.tran: 战利品;因成功获得的好处
entry.def: The spoils of something are things that people get as a result of winning a battle or of doing something successfully.

example.ex: True to military tradition, the victors are now treating themselves to the spoils of war...
example.tran: 按照军事惯例，胜者正在分享战利品。

example.ex: Competing warlords and foreign powers scrambled for political spoils.
example.tran: 相互争斗的军阀及外国列强们正在争夺政治上的收益。

entry.def: If you say that someone is spoilt for choice or spoiled for choice, you mean that they have a great many things of the same type to choose from.

example.ex: At lunchtime, MPs are spoilt for choice in 26 restaurants and bars.
example.tran: 到了午餐时间，议员们有 26 家之多的餐厅和酒吧可供选择。

sentences.sentence: "pampered from earliest childhood, he believed the world had been invented for his entertainment"

means.word_mean: 2. having the character or disposition harmed by pampering or oversolicitous attention;
3. (of foodstuffs) not in an edible or usable condition;

auth_sentence.content: I spoiled a lot of relationships, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: I spoiled a lot of relationships, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I spoiled a lot of relationships, he said.

auth_sentence.content: Plants begin to rot and become spoiled with excrement.
auth_sentence.res_content: Plants begin to rot and become spoiled with excrement.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Plants begin to rot and become spoiled with excrement.

auth_sentence.content: Everything was dirty and spoiled, he says.
auth_sentence.res_content: Everything was dirty and spoiled, he says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Everything was dirty and spoiled, he says.

Sentence.sentence: spoiled his plans to build more hotels in Las Vegas

sentences.en: The child is rather spoiled because his mother has always let him have his own way.
sentences.cn: 这孩子给娇惯坏了,他妈妈总是由着他爱干什么就干什么。
